conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow path of the liquid through the baffles.
Identify the connections between the containers and the baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The image shows containers labeled A, B, C, D, and E with arrows indicating the flow path of liquid through baffles.
Containers A, B, and C are connected to baffles, which in turn connect to containers D and E.
The liquid flows out from containers A, B, and C.
The liquid then passes through the baffles positioned between these containers and the next set of containers.
The baffles are connected to containers D and E.
By examining the flow path, it is clear that the liquid from A, B, and C will flow through the baffles.
The baffles lead directly to container E.
Therefore, the liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
